title: Homomorphisms and isomorphisms of left modules

blocks.name: clmhm
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the generator of left module hom-sets.
blocks.origin: const class clmhm { LMHom }

clmim
blocks.content: The class of left module isomorphism sets.

diff.clmic.c

df-lmhm
blocks.content: A homomorphism of left modules is a group homomorphism which additionally preserves the scalar product. This requires both structures to be left modules over the same ring. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-lmhm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(clmhm, cmpo(s0, s1, clmod, clmod, crab(s2, co(cv(s0), cghm, cv(s1)), wsbc(s3, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(csca, cv(s1)), cv(s3)), wral(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), wral(s5, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s5))), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s5)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-lmhm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ‚ä¢ LMHom =(s0 ‚àà LMod, s1 ‚àà LMod ‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà(s0[GrpHom]s1)|[(Scalar ` s0)/ s3]((Scalar ` s1)= s3 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(Base ` s3), ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà(Base ` s0),(s2 `(s4[(√ó ` s0)]s5))=(s4[(√ó ` s1)](s2 ` s5)))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
}

blocks.name: df-lmim
blocks.content: An isomorphism of modules is a homomorphism which is also a bijection, i.e. it preserves equality as well as the group and scalar operations. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: df-lmic
blocks.content: Two modules are said to be isomorphic iff they are connected by at least one isomorphism. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: reldmlmhm
blocks.content: Lemma for module homomorphisms. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm reldmlmhm() {
  |- wrel(cdm(clmhm))
} = {
  reldmmpt2(hs0, hs1, clmhm, clmod, clmod, crab(hs5, co(cv(hs0), cghm, cv(hs1)), wsbc(hs2, cfv(csca, cv(hs0)), wa(wceq(cfv(csca, cv(hs1)), cv(hs2)), wral(hs3, cfv(cbs, cv(hs2)), wral(hs4, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), wceq(cfv(cv(hs5), co(cv(hs3), cfv(cvsca, cv(hs0)), cv(hs4))), co(cv(hs3), cfv(cvsca, cv(hs1)), cfv(cv(hs5), cv(hs4))))))))))
  df-lmhm(hs0, hs1, hs5, hs2, hs3, hs4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(clmod)
  diff.hs0.s(hs5)
  diff.hs1.s(hs5)
  diff.hs5.s(hs2)
  diff.hs5.s(hs3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs2.s(hs3)
  diff.hs5.s(hs4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs4)
  diff.hs1.s(hs4)
  diff.hs2.s(hs4)
  diff.hs3.s(hs4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm reldmlmhm() {
  ‚ä¢ Rel(dom(LMHom))
} = {
  reldmmpt2(hs0, hs1, clmhm, clmod, clmod, { hs5 ‚àà(hs0[GrpHom]hs1)|[(Scalar ` hs0)/ hs2]((Scalar ` hs1)= hs2 ‚àß ‚àÄ(hs3 ‚àà(Base ` hs2), ‚àÄ(hs4 ‚àà(Base ` hs0),(hs5 `(hs3[(√ó ` hs0)]hs4))=(hs3[(√ó ` hs1)](hs5 ` hs4)))))})
  df-lmhm(hs0, hs1, hs5, hs2, hs3, hs4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(clmod)
  diff.hs0.s(hs5)
  diff.hs1.s(hs5)
  diff.hs5.s(hs2)
  diff.hs5.s(hs3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs2.s(hs3)
  diff.hs5.s(hs4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs4)
  diff.hs1.s(hs4)
  diff.hs2.s(hs4)
  diff.hs3.s(hs4)
}

blocks.name: lmimfn
blocks.content: Lemma for module isomorphisms. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 23-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lmimfn() {
  |- wfn(clmim, cxp(clmod, clmod))
} = {
  fnmpt2i(hs0, hs1, clmim, clmod, clmod, crab(hs2, co(cv(hs0), clmhm, cv(hs1)), wf1o(cv(hs2), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, cv(hs1)))))
  df-lmim(hs0, hs1, hs2)
  rabex(hs2, co(cv(hs0), clmhm, cv(hs1)), wf1o(cv(hs2), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, cv(hs1))))
  ovex(cv(hs0), clmhm, cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(clmod)
  diff.hs1.c(clmod)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs2.c(co(cv(hs0), clmhm, cv(hs1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lmimfn() {
  ‚ä¢ LMIso[Fn](LMod √ó LMod)
} = {
  fnmpt2i(hs0, hs1, clmim, clmod, clmod, { hs2 ‚àà(hs0[LMHom]hs1)|(hs2 :(Base ` hs0)‚Üî(Base ` hs1))})
  df-lmim(hs0, hs1, hs2)
  rabex(hs2, (hs0[LMHom]hs1), (hs2 :(Base ` hs0)‚Üî(Base ` hs1)))
  ovex(hs0, clmhm, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(clmod)
  diff.hs1.c(clmod)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs2.c((hs0[LMHom]hs1))
}

blocks.name: islmhm

blocks.name: lmhmsca
blocks.content: A homomorphism of left modules constrains both modules to the same ring of scalars. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmghm
blocks.content: A homomorphism of left modules is a homomorphism of groups. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmhmlmod2
blocks.content: A homomorphism of left modules has a left module as codomain. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmhmlmod1
blocks.content: A homomorphism of left modules has a left module as domain. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmhmf
blocks.content: A homomorphism of left modules is a function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: islmhmd
blocks.content: Deduction for a module homomorphism. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm islmhmd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvsca, c1))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cvsca, c2))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(csca, c1))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(csca, c2))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c7, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cghm, c2)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c8), wcel(cv(s1), c3))), wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1))), co(cv(s0), c5, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c8)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2))), diffsc(s0, c6))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2))), diffsc(s0, c7))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2))), diffsc(s1, c6))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2))), diffsc(s1, c7))
  syl21anbrc(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)), wcel(c1, clmod), wcel(c2, clmod), w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, cghm, c2)), wceq(c7, c6), wral(s0, c8, wral(s1, c3, wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1))), co(cv(s0), c5, cfv(c0, cv(s1))))))))
  3jca(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cghm, c2)), wceq(c7, c6), wral(s0, c8, wral(s1, c3, wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1))), co(cv(s0), c5, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c8, c3, w0, wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1))), co(cv(s0), c5, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))
  islmhm(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c7, c6, c8, c3, c4, c5)
}

thm islmhmd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(√ó ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(√ó ` c2)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(Scalar ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(Scalar ` c2)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(Base ` c6)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà LMod)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà LMod)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c7 = c6)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[GrpHom]c2))
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c8 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c3))‚Üí(c0 `(s0[c4]s1))=(s0[c5](c0 ` s1)))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c8)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c8)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), d(s0, c6))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), d(s0, c7))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), d(s1, c6))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), d(s1, c7))
  syl21anbrc(w0, c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2), c1 ‚àà LMod, c2 ‚àà LMod, (c0 ‚àà(c1[GrpHom]c2)‚àß c7 = c6 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c8, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c3,(c0 `(s0[c4]s1))=(s0[c5](c0 ` s1))))))
  3jca(w0, c0 ‚àà(c1[GrpHom]c2), c7 = c6, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c8, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c3,(c0 `(s0[c4]s1))=(s0[c5](c0 ` s1)))))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c8, c3, w0, (c0 `(s0[c4]s1))=(s0[c5](c0 ` s1)))
  islmhm(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c7, c6, c8, c3, c4, c5)
}

blocks.name: 0lmhm
blocks.content: The constant zero linear function between two modules. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm 0lmhm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wcel(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), co(c0, clmhm, c1)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(c0g, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(csca, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c1))
} = {
  islmhmd(hs0, hs1, cxp(c4, csn(c5)), c0, c1, c4, cfv(cvsca, c0), cfv(cvsca, c1), c2, c3, cfv(cbs, c2), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3))
  simp2(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3))
  eqcomd(c3, c2, w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)))
  simp3(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3), wcel(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), co(c0, cghm, c1)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wcel(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), co(c0, cghm, c1)), wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  lmodgrp(c0)
  lmodgrp(c1)
  0ghm(c0, c1, c4, c5)
  3eqtr4rd(cfv(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1))), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), cfv(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), cv(hs1))), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), c5), c5, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), c5), c5), wcel(c1, clmod), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3)))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4)))
  eleqtrd(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cbs, c2), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))))
  fveq2d(cbs, c2, c3, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4)))
  lmodvs0(c1, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cvsca, c1), c5, c3)
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
  ad2antll(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), cfv(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), cv(hs1))), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), c5)))
  oveq2d(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), cfv(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), cv(hs1)), c5, wcel(cv(hs1), c4))
  fvconst2(cv(hs1), c4, c5)
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))), wceq(cfv(cxp(c4, csn(c5)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1))), c5), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), c4))
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), c4), wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4)))
  simprl(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))
  simprr(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod), wceq(c2, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), c4))
  lmodvscl(c0, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c2), cv(hs1), c4, cfv(cvsca, c0), c2)
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c0))

blocks.name: lmhmvsca
blocks.content: The pointwise scalar product of a linear function and a constant is linear, over a commutative ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)

  adantll((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß ran(c3)‚äÜ c1), c3 ‚àà(c4[LMHom]c0), (hs0 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` c4))‚àß hs1 ‚àà(Base ` c4)), (c3 `(hs0[(√ó ` c4)]hs1))=(hs0[(√ó ` c0)](c3 ` hs1)))

blocks.name: lmhmeql
blocks.content: The equalizer of two module homomorphisms is a subspace. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Mar-2015.)

thm lmhmeql(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)‚àß c3 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2))‚Üí dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3))‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(LSubSp ` c1)
} = {
  mpbir2and((c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)‚àß c3 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3))‚àà c4, dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3))‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` c1)), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)),(hs0[(√ó ` c1)]hs1)‚àà dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)))))
  syl2an(c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2), c3 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2), dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3))‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c0 ‚àà(c1[GrpHom]c2), c3 ‚àà(c1[GrpHom]c2))
  lmghm(c0, c1, c2)
  lmghm(c3, c1, c2)
  ghmeql(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  ralrimiva(hs0, (Base `(Scalar ` c1)), (c0 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)‚àß c3 ‚àà(c1[LMHom]c2)), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)),(hs0[(√ó ` c1)]hs1)‚àà dom((c0 ‚ãÇ c3))))

blocks.name: lspextmo
blocks.content: A linear function is completely determined (or overdetermined) by its values on a spanning subset. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Mar-2015.) (Revised by NM, 17-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: lmimf1o
blocks.content: An isomorphism of left modules is a bijection. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmimlmhm
blocks.content: An isomorphism of modules is a homomorphism. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmimgim
blocks.content: An isomorphism of modules is an isomorphism of groups. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-May-2015.)

blocks.name: islmim2
blocks.content: An isomorphism of left modules is a homomorphism whose converse is a homomorphism. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-May-2015.)

blocks.name: lmimcnv
blocks.content: The converse of a bijective module homomorphism is a bijective module homomorphism. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lmimcnv(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmim, c2)), wcel(ccnv(c0), co(c2, clmim, c1)))
} = {
  3imtr4i(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmim, c2)), wcel(ccnv(c0), co(c2, clmim, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)), wcel(ccnv(c0), co(c2, clmhm, c1))), wa(wcel(ccnv(c0), co(c2, clmhm, c1)), wcel(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), co(c1, clmhm, c2))))
  anim1ci(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)), wcel(ccnv(c0), co(c2, clmhm, c1)), wcel(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), co(c1, clmhm, c2)))
  eqeltrd(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), co(c1, clmhm, c2), c0, wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)))
  sylib(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)), wceq(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0), wrel(c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)), wrel(c0), wf(c0, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c2)))
  lmhmf(c0, c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c2))
  frel(c0, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c2))
  dfrel2(c0)
  id(wcel(c0, co(c1, clmhm, c2)))
  islmim2(c0, c1, c2)
  islmim2(ccnv(c0), c2, c1)
}

blocks.name: brlmic
blocks.content: The relation "is isomorphic to" for modules. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: brlmici
blocks.content: Prove isomorphic by an explicit isomorphism. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lmiclcl

blocks.name: lmicsym
